page.title: 13LIFE STYLES
page.content: There are numerous pubs and hotels in the area.The majority are in the villages and hamlets and these retain all their olde worlde charm.Most are the original old buildings and an example of this is the Greyhound Inn at Fallgate.This was used as a Magistrates court in past times and is named after a noted local greyhound named Nellie who won many races. This inn serves meals. Clay pigeon shooting is catered for and there is a thriving club for members. The newly developing sport of hang gliding takes place at Milltown. Guides,Brownies and Womens Institute members have to go out of this area for their activities.
